title: C08-2010

sentences.text: Language resource quality is crucial in NLP .
Many of the resources used are derived from data created by human beings out of an NLP context , especially regarding MT and reference translations .
Indeed , automatic evaluations need high-quality data that allow the comparison of both automatic and human translations .
The validation of these resources is widely recommended before being used .
This paper describes the impact of using different-quality references on evaluation .
Surprisingly enough , similar scores are obtained in many cases regardless of the quality .
Thus , the limitations of the automatic metrics used within MT are also discussed in this regard .

Entity-language_resource_quality.label: Language resource quality
Entity-language_resource_quality.description: Language resource quality refers to the assessment and validation of the quality of linguistic resources used in natural language processing (NLP), which is essential for ensuring accurate evaluations in tasks such as machine translation.

Entity-the_impact_of_using_different-qua.label: the impact of using different-quality references
aliases: the impact of using different-quality references
Entity-the_impact_of_using_different-qua.description: The impact of using different-quality references refers to the effects that varying levels of reference data quality have on the evaluation outcomes in natural language processing, particularly in machine translation, highlighting that similar evaluation scores can be achieved despite differences in reference quality.

mentions.local_name: the impact of using different-quality references

Entity-quality.label: quality
Entity-quality.description: In the context of the paper, 'quality' refers to the standard or grade of language resources used in natural language processing (NLP), particularly in relation to machine translation (MT) and reference translations.

Entity-resource.label: resources
Entity-resource.description: The term 'resources' refers to language resources, specifically high-quality data derived from human-created materials used in natural language processing (NLP), particularly in machine translation (MT) and reference translations.

Entity-different-quality_reference.label: different-quality references
Entity-different-quality_reference.description: Different-quality references refer to varying levels of quality in the reference data used for evaluating machine translation systems, which can significantly influence the outcomes of automatic evaluations.

Entity-this_paper.label: This paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper investigates how varying quality of reference data affects the evaluation of machine translation, revealing that similar evaluation scores can be achieved despite differences in reference quality.

Entity-the_limitation_of_the_automatic_m.label: the limitations of the automatic metrics
aliases: the limitations of the automatic metrics
Entity-the_limitation_of_the_automatic_m.description: The limitations of the automatic metrics refer to the shortcomings and challenges associated with using automated evaluation methods in machine translation (MT), particularly in relation to their reliance on the quality of reference data and their ability to accurately reflect the effectiveness of translations.

mentions.local_name: the limitations of the automatic metrics

Entity-these_resource.label: these resources
Entity-these_resource.description: The mention 'these resources' refers to language resources used in natural language processing (NLP), particularly those derived from human-created data for machine translation (MT) and reference translations.

Entity-evaluation.label: evaluation
Entity-evaluation.description: The term 'evaluation' refers to the process of assessing the quality of language resources in natural language processing, particularly through the comparison of automatic and human translations using high-quality data.

Entity-automatic_evaluation.label: automatic evaluations
Entity-automatic_evaluation.description: Automatic evaluations refer to assessment methods in natural language processing that utilize high-quality data to compare the performance of automatic translation systems against human translations.

Entity-reference_translation.label: reference translations
Entity-reference_translation.description: Reference translations are authoritative translations used as benchmarks or standards for evaluating the quality of other translations in the field of natural language processing and machine translation.

Entity-the_validation_of_these_resource.label: The validation of these resources
Entity-the_validation_of_these_resource.description: The validation of these resources refers to the process of assessing and ensuring the quality and reliability of language resources used in natural language processing, particularly before their application in automatic evaluations and machine translation.

Entity-data.label: data
Entity-data.description: The term 'data' refers to information generated by humans in the context of natural language processing (NLP), particularly in relation to machine translation (MT) and reference translations.

Entity-nlp_context.label: NLP context
Entity-nlp_context.description: NLP context refers to the specific environment or setting in which natural language processing resources and data are generated, particularly in relation to machine translation and reference translations.

Entity-data_created_by_human_being.label: data created by human beings
Entity-data_created_by_human_being.description: Data created by human beings refers to the various types of information and resources generated by individuals, particularly in contexts outside of natural language processing (NLP), which are utilized for tasks such as machine translation (MT) and reference translations.

Entity-automatic_metric.label: automatic metrics
Entity-automatic_metric.description: Automatic metrics are quantitative evaluation tools that assess the performance or quality of systems, such as machine translation, without human intervention.

Entity-similar_score.label: similar scores
Entity-similar_score.description: The term 'similar scores' refers to the comparable evaluation results obtained from different-quality reference translations in the context of automatic metrics used in machine translation.

Entity-nlp.label: NLP
Entity-nlp.description: NLP refers to the field of study focused on the interaction between computers and human language, encompassing techniques and technologies for processing and analyzing natural language data.

Entity-mt.label: MT
Entity-mt.description: MT refers to machine translation, a technology in natural language processing that involves the automatic translation of text from one language to another.

Entity-human_translation.label: human translations
Entity-human_translation.description: Human translations refer to text or content that has been translated from one language to another by a human translator, as opposed to being generated by automated translation systems.

Entity-validation.label: validation
Entity-validation.description: Validation refers to the process of ensuring the quality and reliability of language resources before their use in natural language processing applications.

Entity-high-quality_data.label: high-quality data
Entity-high-quality_data.description: high-quality data refers to data that is accurate, reliable, and relevant, making it suitable for analysis and decision-making.

Entity-reference.label: references
Entity-reference.description: References are sources or citations used to support claims or provide evidence in academic and scholarly work.

Entity-paper.label: paper
Entity-paper.description: A paper is a written work that presents research findings, analyses, or arguments, typically in an academic or scholarly context.

Entity-human_being.label: human beings
Entity-human_being.description: Human beings are sentient, social organisms belonging to the species Homo sapiens, characterized by advanced cognitive abilities, language use, and the capacity for complex social structures.

summary: Language resource quality is crucial in NLP . Many of the resources used are derived from data created by human beings out of an NLP context , especially regarding MT and reference translations . Indeed , automatic evaluations need high-quality data that allow the comparison of both automatic and human translations . The validation of these resources is widely recommended before being used . This paper describes the impact of using different-quality references on evaluation . Surprisingly enough , similar scores are obtained in many cases regardless of the quality . Thus , the limitations of the automatic metrics used within MT are also discussed in this regard .

Predicate-is_crucial_in.label: is crucial in
Predicate-is_crucial_in.description: The predicate 'is crucial in' indicates that the subject plays a vital or essential role in the context of the object. It suggests that the subject significantly impacts, influences, or contributes to the effectiveness, success, or functionality of the object, highlighting the importance of the subject within that specific domain or area.

Predicate-are_derived_from.label: are derived from
Predicate-are_derived_from.description: The predicate 'are derived from' indicates a relationship where the subject is produced, obtained, or developed as a result of the object. It implies a source or origin from which the subject has emerged, suggesting a dependency or connection between the two entities.

Predicate-is_created_by.label: is created by
Predicate-is_created_by.description: The predicate 'is created by' establishes a relationship where the subject is the result of a process or action performed by the object. It indicates that the object, typically a person or group, is the agent responsible for the formation, development, or generation of the subject, highlighting the active role of the creator in bringing the subject into existence.

Predicate-is_created_out_of.label: is created out of
Predicate-is_created_out_of.description: The predicate 'is created out of' indicates a relationship where the subject is formed or generated from the components or elements represented by the object. It implies a process of transformation or synthesis, where the subject emerges as a result of utilizing or combining the characteristics, materials, or concepts denoted by the object.

Predicate-need.label: need
Predicate-need.description: The predicate 'need' establishes a relationship where the subject requires or depends on the object to fulfill a certain function, achieve a goal, or maintain a state. It indicates that the absence of the object would hinder the subject's effectiveness or capability.

Predicate-is_recommended_before_being_us.label: is recommended before being used
Predicate-is_recommended_before_being_us.description: The predicate 'is recommended before being used' indicates that the subject should undergo a prior evaluation or assessment process before it is utilized in relation to the object. This suggests a precautionary measure aimed at ensuring the effectiveness, safety, or appropriateness of the subject in the context of the object, thereby promoting informed and responsible usage.

Predicate-is_widely_recommended_before_b.label: is widely recommended before being used
Predicate-is_widely_recommended_before_b.description: The predicate 'is widely recommended before being used' indicates that the subject is advised or suggested by a significant number of sources or authorities to be utilized only after a certain condition or process has been fulfilled, which is represented by the object. This implies a level of caution or necessity for verification, ensuring that the object is deemed appropriate or safe for use following the subject's guidance.

Predicate-describes.label: describes
Predicate-describes.description: The predicate 'describes' indicates a relationship where the subject provides an explanation, account, or representation of the object. It signifies that the subject conveys information or details about the object, allowing for a clearer understanding or insight into the nature, characteristics, or implications of the object.

Predicate-on.label: on
Predicate-on.description: The predicate 'on' indicates a relationship where the subject has a direct influence, effect, or relevance to the object. It suggests that the subject is a factor that impacts, pertains to, or is associated with the object in some significant way.

Predicate-are_discussed_in.label: are discussed in
Predicate-are_discussed_in.description: The predicate 'are discussed in' indicates that the subject is the topic of conversation or analysis within the context of the object. It establishes a relationship where the subject is examined, evaluated, or elaborated upon in the specified domain or medium represented by the object.

Predicate-are_discussed_in_regard_to.label: are discussed in regard to
Predicate-are_discussed_in_regard_to.description: The predicate 'are discussed in regard to' indicates that the subject is the focus of a conversation or analysis that pertains to the object. It suggests that the subject is being examined, evaluated, or considered in the context of the object, highlighting a relationship where the subject's characteristics, implications, or relevance are being explored in relation to the object.

Predicate-affects.label: affects
Predicate-affects.description: The predicate 'affects' denotes a relationship in which the subject has an influence or effect on the object. It implies that changes or variations in the subject lead to corresponding changes in the object, indicating a causal or relational connection between the two entities.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a more specific instance or category that falls under the wider category represented by the object. This relationship implies that the object encompasses a broader scope or definition that includes the subject as a subset.
